question: __________ consists of two or more basic service sets interconnected by a distribution system.
explanation: Extended Service Set consists of two or more basic service sets interconnected by a distribution system.

question: IEEE 802.11 defines ___________ services that need to be provided by the wireless LAN to achieve functionality equivalent to that which is inherent to wired LANs.
explanation: There are 9 services provided by IEEE 802.11.

question: ___________ services are used to control IEEE 302.11 LAN access and confidentiality.
explanation: Three of the services provided by IEEE 302.11 LAN are used to control access and confidentiality.

question: __________ services are used to control IEEE 302.11 LAN delivery of MDSUs between stations.
explanation: 6 services are used to control IEEE 302.11 LAN delivery of MDSUs between stations.

question: _________ services are implemented in every 802.11 station, including AP stations. _________ services are provided between BSSs.
explanation: Station services are implemented in every 802.11 station, including AP stations. Distribution services are provided between BSSs.

question: The _________ service enables transfer of data between a station on an IEEE 802.11 LAN and a station on an integrated IEEE 802.x LAN.
explanation: The integration service enables transfer of data between a station on an IEEE 802.11 LAN and a station on an integrated IEEE 802.x LAN.

question: When a station moves only within the direct communication range of the communication stations of a single BSS, it is referred to as –
explanation: When a station moves only within the direct communication range of the communication stations of a single BSS, it is referred to as No transition.

question: A station movement from one BSS in one ESS to a BSS within another ESS falls under –
explanation: A station movement from one BSS in one ESS to a BSS within another ESS falls under ESS transition.
